Value.label: Wake up 10 minutes on Power On
Value.Help: Stay awake for 10 minutes after batteries are inserted

Value.label: On time
Value.Help: Duration that the motion sensor must observe no motion before it will return to the no-motion state. If value greater than 255, effective value is rounded up to the nearest minute (255 -> 255 seconds, 256 -> 300 seconds)

Value.label: Enable Motion Sensor
Value.Help: Enable Motion Sensor

Value.label: Command Options
Value.Help: Which commands to send when PIR motion sensor triggered OZW Ideal Value is Binary Sensor Report

Value.label: Low Battery
Value.Help: Configure low battery value Value=10 to 50.

Value.label: Report Only On Thresholds
Value.Help: Enable/disable the selective reporting only when measurements reach a certain threshold or percentage set in the threshold settings. This is used to reduce network traffic.

Value.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in temperature to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is Fahrenheit for US version, Celsius for EU/AU version. 2. The value contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20, the threshold value = 2.0 C (EU/AU) or 2.0 F (US). When the temperature has changed by 2.0 (of the appropriate unit), a temperature report will be sent.

Value.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in humidity to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is %. 2. The default value is 10, which means that a 10% change in humidity will trigger a report.

Value.label: Luminance Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in luminance to induce an automatic report.

Value.label: Battery Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in battery level to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is %. 2. The default value is 10, which means that a 10% change in battery will trigger a report.

Value.label: UV Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in ultraviolet to induce an automatic report.

Value.label: Low Temp Alarm
Value.Help: Enable/disable to send the alarm report of low temperature(Less than 15 Degress C)

Value.label: Temperature scale
Value.Help: Default value: Celsius for EU/AU version, Fahrenheit for US version.

Value.label: LED report
Value.Help: LED when motion/vibration triggered

Value.label: Reset Params 101-103 to Default
Value.Help: Reset The Reporting Group Configuration (101 to 103) to default

Value.label: Group 1 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 1. Bitmask: 10000000 - 128 - Luminance 01000000 - 64 - Humidity 00100000 - 32 - Temperature 00010000 - 16 - Ultraviolet 00000001 - 1 - Battery 10100000 - 160 - Luminance and Temperature (32+128) 11110001 - 241 - All (1+16+32+64+128)

Value.label: Group 2 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 2. Bitmask: 10000000 - 128 - Luminance 01000000 - 64 - Humidity 00100000 - 32 - Temperature 00010000 - 16 - Ultraviolet 00000001 - 1 - Battery 10100000 - 160 - Luminance and Temperature (32+128) 11110001 - 241 - All (1+16+32+64+128)

Value.label: Group 3 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 3. Bitmask: 10000000 - 128 - Luminance 01000000 - 64 - Humidity 00100000 - 32 - Temperature 00010000 - 16 - Ultraviolet 00000001 - 1 - Battery 10100000 - 160 - Luminance and Temperature (32+128) 11110001 - 241 - All (1+16+32+64+128)

Value.label: Reset Params 111-113 to Default
Value.Help: Reset The Reporting Group Interval Configuration (111 to 113) to default

Value.label: Group 1 Interval
Value.Help: The interval for sending reports for group 1. The effective behavior of this setting depends on the device's power source: - If the device is on USB power, it will send the reports at the configured interval; set it to something low (~15-60 seconds) to get frequent updates from a powered device. - If the device is on battery, the sensor will never report in more often than its configured wake interval, regardless of what this setting is configured to; setting this to 3601 when the wake interval is 3600 would make this group report in every 7200 seconds. 240 seconds is the minimum wake interval, but will quickly use battery.

Value.label: Group 2 Interval
Value.Help: The interval for sending reports for group 2. The effective behavior of this setting depends on the device's power source: - If the device is on USB power, it will send the reports at the configured interval; set it to something low (~15-60 seconds) to get frequent updates from a powered device. - If the device is on battery, the sensor will never report in more often than its configured wake interval, regardless of what this setting is configured to; setting this to 3601 when the wake interval is 3600 would make this group report in every 7200 seconds. 240 seconds is the minimum wake interval, but will quickly use battery.

Value.label: Group 3 Interval
Value.Help: The interval for sending reports for group 3. The effective behavior of this setting depends on the device's power source: - If the device is on USB power, it will send the reports at the configured interval; set it to something low (~15-60 seconds) to get frequent updates from a powered device. - If the device is on battery, the sensor will never report in more often than its configured wake interval, regardless of what this setting is configured to; setting this to 3601 when the wake interval is 3600 would make this group report in every 7200 seconds. 240 seconds is the minimum wake interval, but will quickly use battery.

Value.label: Temperature Calibration
Value.Help: The calibration value = standard value - measure value. (the available value range is [-100, 100] or [-10C, 10C]). Note: 1. The value contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20, the calibration value is 2.0 (EU/AU version) or 2.0 (US version) 2. The calibration value = standard value - measure value. If measure value =25.3 and the standard value = 23.2, so the calibration value= 23.2-25.3 = -2.1 (0xEB). If the measure value =30.1 and the standard value = 33.2, so the calibration value= 33.2-30.1= 3.1 (0x1F). Default value: 1 for EU/AU version, 2 for US version.

Value.label: Humidity Calibration
Value.Help: The calibration value = standard value - measure value. (the available value range is [-50, 50]). If measure value =80RH and the standard value = 75RH, so the calibration value= 75RH-80RH = -5RH (0xFB). If the measure value =85RH and the standard value = 90RH, so the calibration value= 90RH-85RH = 5RH (0x05).

Value.label: Luminance Calibration
Value.Help: The calibration value = standard value - measure value. (the available value range is [-1000, 1000]). If measure value =800Lux and the standard value = 750Lux, so the calibration value= 750-800 = -50 (0xFFCE). If the measure value =850Lux and the standard value = 900Lux, so the calibration value= 900-850 = 50 (0x0032).

Value.label: Ultraviolet Calibration
Value.Help: The calibration value = standard value measure value. (the available value range is [-10, 10]). If measure value =9 and the standard value = 8, so the calibration value= 8-9 = -1 (0xFE). If the measure value =7 and the standard value = 9, so the calibration value= 9-7 = 2 (0x02).

Value.label: Enable/disable Lock Configuration
Value.Help: Enable/disable Lock Configuration

Value.label: Reset to default
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults.

Group.label: LifeLine

Value.label: Set to Default
Value.Help: Upper paddle buttons mode.

Item.label: In pair mode, left side sends on/up commands, right side sends off/down commands.

Value.label: Set to Default
Value.Help: Lower paddle buttons mode.

Item.label: In pair mode, left side sends on/up commands, right side sends off/down commands.

Value.label: Set to Default (1)
Value.Help: LED #1 mode.

Item.label: LED indication is disabled (LED can be controlled by Indicator Command Class Set commands)
LED indicates the status of the corresponding button.
LED indicates the status of the corresponding button, with inverted indication.
LED indicates the status of corresponding paddle (in pair mode).
LED indicates the status of the corresponding paddle (in pair mode), with inverted indication.
LED indicates the status of the built-in relay.
LED indicates the status of the built-in relay, with inverted indication.
LED show a 5 seconds indication when the corresponding button is pressed.

Value.label: Set to Default (1)
Value.Help: LED #2 mode.

Item.label: LED indication is disabled (LED can be controlled by Indicator Command Class Set commands)
LED indicates the status of the corresponding button.
LED indicates the status of the corresponding button, with inverted indication.
LED indicates the status of corresponding paddle (in pair mode).
LED indicates the status of the corresponding paddle (in pair mode), with inverted indication.
LED indicates the status of the built-in relay.
LED indicates the status of the built-in relay, with inverted indication.
LED show a 5 seconds indication when the corresponding button is pressed.

Value.label: Set to Default (1)
Value.Help: LED #3 mode.

Item.label: LED indication is disabled (LED can be controlled by Indicator Command Class Set commands)
LED indicates the status of the corresponding button.
LED indicates the status of the corresponding button, with inverted indication.
LED indicates the status of corresponding paddle (in pair mode).
LED indicates the status of the corresponding paddle (in pair mode), with inverted indication.
LED indicates the status of the built-in relay.
LED indicates the status of the built-in relay, with inverted indication.
LED show a 5 seconds indication when the corresponding button is pressed.

Value.label: Set to Default (1)
Value.Help: LED #4 mode.

Item.label: LED indication is disabled (LED can be controlled by Indicator Command Class Set commands)
LED indicates the status of the corresponding button.
LED indicates the status of the corresponding button, with inverted indication.
LED indicates the status of corresponding paddle (in pair mode).
LED indicates the status of the corresponding paddle (in pair mode), with inverted indication.
LED indicates the status of the built-in relay.
LED indicates the status of the built-in relay, with inverted indication.
LED show a 5 seconds indication when the corresponding button is pressed.

Value.label: LED #1 brightness level.
Value.Help: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is on.

Value.label: LED #2 brightness level.
Value.Help: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is on.

Value.label: LED #3 brightness level.
Value.Help: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is on.

Value.label: LED #4 brightness level.
Value.Help: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is on.

Value.label: LED #1 off brightness level.
Value.Help: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is off.

Value.label: LED #2 off brightness level.
Value.Help: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is off.

Value.label: LED #3 off brightness level.
Value.Help: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is off.

Value.label: LED #4 off brightness level.
Value.Help: 0 - 100 Specifies the brightness level of the LED when it is off.

Value.label: Relay mode
Value.Help: Defines the relay mode.

Item.label: Relay is controlled by button #1 or by upper paddle when pair mode is active.
Relay is controlled by button #2 or by upper paddle when pair mode is active.
Relay is controlled by button #3 or by lower paddle when pair mode is active.
Relay is controlled by button #4 or by lower paddle when pair mode is active.
Relay is activated for one second and is controlled by button #1 or by upper paddle when pair mode is active.

Value.label: indicator mode
Value.Help: Defines the Indicator mode.

Item.label: Indicator Set level values are only used to control the LED.
Indicator Set level values are also used by internal LED activations.

Value.label: Scene notification offset
Value.Help: Button #1 will send scene [value], button #2 will send scene [value] + 1, button #3 will send scene [value] + 2, button #4 will send scene [value] + 3. (Default = 1)

Value.label: Disable House Cleaning Mode
Value.Help: Enable/Disable House Cleaning Mode

Item.label: House Cleaning Mode is disabled; double-press button scene notifications will be disabled too.

Value.label: Multilevel Switch on single press for device 1 (button #1)
Value.Help: Multilevel Switch on single press for device 1 (button #1)

Value.label: Multilevel Switch on single press for device 2 (button #2)
Value.Help: Multilevel Switch on single press for device 2 (button #2)

Value.label: Multilevel Switch on single press for device 3 (button #3)
Value.Help: Multilevel Switch on single press for device 3 (button #3)

Value.label: Multilevel Switch on single press for device 4 (button #4)
Value.Help: Multilevel Switch on single press for device 4 (button #4)

Value.label: Control of association groups for device 1 (button #1)
Value.Help: Control of association groups for device 1 (button #1)

Item.label: When commands are received by device 1, nodes in the association groups will not be switched, button activations will still send switch values.
When commands are received by device 1, nodes in the association groups will be switched.

Value.label: Control of association groups for device 2 (button #2)
Value.Help: Control of association groups for device 2 (button #2)

Item.label: When commands are received by device 2, nodes in the association groups will not be switched, button activations will still send switch values.
When commands are received by device 2, nodes in the association groups will be switched.

Value.label: Control of association groups for device 3 (button #3)
Value.Help: Control of association groups for device 3 (button #3)

Item.label: When commands are received by device 3, nodes in the association groups will not be switched, button activations will still send switch values.
When commands are received by device 3, nodes in the association groups will be switched.

Value.label: Control of association groups for device 4 (button #4)
Value.Help: Control of association groups for device 4 (button #4)

Item.label: When commands are received by device 4, nodes in the association groups will not be switched, button activations will still send switch values.
When commands are received by device 4, nodes in the association groups will be switched.

Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #1 is used.

Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #2 is used.

Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #3 is used.
Send Basic Report (On/Off) when button #4 is used.

Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #4 is used..
Send Binary Toggle Switch Set when button #4 is used.
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #4 is used.

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: First channel - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S1 switch.

Value.label: First channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S1 terminal

Item.label: Cancel mode and set target state
No reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

Value.label: First channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes. (s)

Value.label: First channel - pulse time for flashing mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode. 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step)

Value.label: Second channel - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 2st channel controlled by the S2 switch.

Value.label: Second channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S2 terminal

Item.label: Cancel mode and set target state
No reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

Value.label: Second channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes. (s)

Value.label: Second channel - pulse time for flashing mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode. 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step)

Value.label: Switch type
Value.Help: Inputs type configuration

Item.label: Toggle switch (contact closed - On, contact opened - OFF)
Toggle switch (device changes status when switch changes status)

Value.label: Flashing mode report
Value.Help: Enabled / Disabled reports on Flashing mode

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent to specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. This parameter does not apply to 1st lifeline group. 1 - 2nd group sent as secure. 2 - 3rd group sent as secure. 4 - 4th group sent as secure. 8 - 5th group sent as secure. Default setting: 15 (all)

Value.label: S1 switch - scenes sent
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. 1 - Key pressed 1 time. 2 - Key pressed 2 times. 4 - Key pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released. Default setting: 0 (none)

Value.label: S2 switch - scenes sent
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. 1 - Key pressed 1 time. 2 - Key pressed 2 times. 4 - Key pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released. Default setting: 0 (none)

Value.label: S1 associations sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group. All actions are active by default. 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch. 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch. 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch. 8 - ignore double click of the switch. Default setting: 0

Value.label: S1 Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S1 Switch OFF value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Switch Off command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S1 Switch Double Click value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Double Click command to de- vices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S2 associations sent to 4nd and 5rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 4nd and 5rd association group. All actions are active by default. 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch. 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch. 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch. 8 - ignore double click of the switch. Default setting: 0

Value.label: S2 Switch ON value sent to 4nd and 5rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 4nd and 5rd association group.

Value.label: S2 Switch OFF value sent to 4nd and 5rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Switch Off command to devices associated in 4nd and 5rd association group.

Value.label: S2 Switch Double Click value sent to 4nd and 5rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter de nes value sent with Double Click command to de- vices associated in 4nd and 5rd association group.

Value.label: Reaction to General Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to General Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to Flood Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to Flood Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to Heat Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to Heat alarm frame.

Value.label: Flashing alarm duration
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set duration of flashing alarm mode 1-32000 (0.1-32000s, 1s step) Default: 600 (10min)

Value.label: First channel - power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller. 1-100 (%) Default 20 (20%)

Value.label: First channel - minimal time between power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller. 1-120 (s) Default 10 (10s)

Value.label: First channel - energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller 1-32000 (0.01-320 kWh) Default 100 (1kWh)

Value.label: Second Channel - power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller. 1-100 (%) Default 20 (20%)

Value.label: Second channel - minimal time between power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller. 1-120 (s) Default 10 (10s)

Value.label: Second channel - energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller 1-32000 (0.01-320 kWh) Default 100 (1kWh)

Value.label: Periodic power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Periodic energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Measuring energy consumed by the device itself
Value.Help: This parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the device itself. Results are being added to energy reports for first endpoint.

Group.label: Lifeline
On/Off S1
Dimmer S1
On/Off S2
Dimmer S2
Lifeline
On/Off S1
Dimmer S1
On/Off S2
Dimmer S2

Value.label: Operation Mode
Value.Help: Parameter defines device operation mode.

Item.label: Door/Window Sensor or external alarm sensor

Value.label: DOOR/WINDOW/ALARM
Value.Help: Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. If you connect the alarm sensor, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Value.label: Visual LED indications
Value.Help: This parameter defines events indicated by the visual LED indicator. Disabling events might extend battery life. 0 - no indications 1 - indication of opening/closing status change (input IN) 2 - indication of wake up (1 x click or periodical) 4 - indication of device tampering

Value.label: Range test after double click
Value.Help: Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. If you connect the alarm sensor, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Value.label: 2nd association group triggers
Value.Help: Parameter defines events which result in sending on/off commands to devices added to the 2nd association group. These commands are sent alternately to switch the devices on and off. Commands represent the values of BASIC SET command frames. Parameter is inactive in external button mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Value.label: Commands sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: Command frames sent to devices added to the 2nd association group.

Value.label: Value of ON command frame sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.

Value.label: Value of OFF command frame sent to 2nd association group
Value.Help: The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.

Value.label: Time delay of ON command frame
Value.Help: Time period after which ON command frame will be sent.

Value.label: Time delay of OFF command frame
Value.Help: Time period after which OFF command frame will be sent.

Value.label: Type of sent alarm frames
Value.Help: Type of control frames transmitted to the main controller and 3rd association group Alarm. If an external sensor is connected to IN input, it is possible to choose its functionality. Otherwise it is recommended to set this parameter to default value.

Value.label: Delay of tamper alarm cancellation
Value.Help: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.

Value.label: Reporting tamper alarm cancellation
Value.Help: Reporting cancellation of tamper alarm to the controller and 5th association group.

Item.label: Do not send tamper cancellation report

Value.label: Interval of temperature measurements
Value.Help: This parameter defines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten. 0 - temperature measurements disabled 5-32400 - time in seconds

Value.label: Temperature reports threshold
Value.Help: This parameter defines the change of temperature in comparison with last reported, resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller. 0 - temperature reports based on threshold disabled 1-300 - temperature threshold (0.1-30C, 0.1C step)

Value.label: Interval of temperature reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller. 0 - periodic temperature reports disabled 5-32400 - time in seconds

Value.label: Temperature offset
Value.Help: The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation). (0,1C steps)

Value.label: Temperature alarm reports
Value.Help: Temperature alarms reported to the Z-Wave controller. Thresholds are set in parameters 55 and 56.

Value.label: High temperature alarm threshold
Value.Help: If temperature is higher than set value, overheat notification will be sent and high temperature scene will be triggered (if activated). 0-1000 (0-100C, 0.1C step).

Value.label: Low temperature alarm threshold
Value.Help: If temperature is lower than the set value, underheat notification will be sent and low temperature scene will be triggered (if activated). 300-700 (-30-70C, 0.1C step)

Value.label: Scene activation functionality
Value.Help: The device can trigger scenes using scene IDs assigned to different events. To deactivate all scenes set the value to 0. To activate all scenes set the value to 3903. 1 - [ID 10] opening door/window (single click). 2 - [ID 11] closing door/window (single click). 4 - [ID 12] holding. 8 - [ID 13] releasing. 16 - [ID 14] double click. 32 - [ID 15] triple click. 256 - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window opened. 512 - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window closed. 1024 - [ID 51] low temperature - door/window opened. 2048 - [ID 51] low temperature - door/window closed.

Value.label: Alarm broadcast
Value.Help: Settings for broadcasting ON/OFF commands, sensor alarm and tamper alarm. Value other than 0 means alarms are sent in Broadcast Mode, to all devices only within the range of the device. They are not repeated by the mesh network. 0 - broadcasts inactive. 1 - ON/OFF commands broadcast active. 2 - sensor alarm broadcast active. 4 - tamper alarm broadcast active.

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st group Lifeline 0 - none of the groups sent as secure. 1 - 2nd group Control sent as secure. 2 - 3rd group Alarm sent as secure. 4 - 4th group Sensor ZW3 sent as secure. 8 - 5th group Tamper ZW3 sent as secure.

Group.label: Lifeline
Control BASIC SET reports
Alarm reports
Sensor ZW3 BASIC SET reports
Tamper ZW3 tamper alarm
Lifeline
Control BASIC SET reports
Alarm reports
Sensor ZW3 BASIC SET reports
Tamper ZW3 tamper alarm
